intro: Cyrtandra intravillosa, commonly known as the hairy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
